title: Saints center Will Clapp done for season in crushing injury blow
description: He spent two seasons with the Chargers and was a member of the Bills in 2024 before re-signing with New Orleans in March.
content:
Saints center Will Clapp’s season is over before it even started.

The Saints put Clapp, 29, on injured reserve Tuesday afternoon, with what NFL Network reported is a Lisfranc injury that occurred during the team’s preseason opener on Sunday when he was carted off the field.

The move ended his year before he could suit up in the regular season and prevented what would have been a feel-good story for the franchise, with Clapp being a New Orleans native, an LSU alum and a seventh-round pick by the Saints in 2018.

Players who are placed on IR during the preseason are not eligible to return.

Clapp spent his first four seasons in the NFL with the Saints, appearing in 34 games — seven of which were starts — during that span.

He spent two seasons with the Chargers and was a member of the Bills in 2024 before re-signing with New Orleans in March.

“I remember I was just chilling at the house one day, playing on the ground with my son, and my agent called me. The Saints were talking about getting a contract done, and I was just so excited,” Clapp said in a video posted by the Saints back in March. “I couldn’t believe it was probably going to come together, and from that moment on, I was just pretty focused. I was like, ‘Hey, let’s just get this done. I don’t want to entertain anything else right now.’”

With starting center Erik McCoy dealing with injuries, Torricelli Simpkins will likely be the next man up at the position.
summary: Saints center Will Clapp, a New Orleans native, has been placed on injured reserve by the team due to a Lisfranc injury during the team's preseason opener. This decision prevents him from playing in the regular season. Players placed on IR during the preseason are not eligible to return.
shortSummary: Saints center Will Clapp is out for the season with a Lisfranc injury, ending a promising tenure with the team.

scraped_sources.text:
CBS reporter Amanda Balionis enjoyed some R&R in Ibiza before she hits the sidelines for the 2025 NFL season.
Taking to Instagram, Balionis shared a carousel of snapshots from the trip she took with her grade school friends and their partners.
“Hey Ibiza.. It was really nice to meet ya 🤝 Never take for granted that many of my best friends are the ones I met in elementary school,” Balionis, 39, captioned the Saturday post. “To take this trip with them… well I think 5th grade us would be really proud of how far we’ve come, and that we continue to choose to do it together ❤️❤️ also shoutout to the guys for marrying the most fun partners 🫡.”
Balionis looked stunning in a white bikini as she enjoyed a coconut cocktail under the sun.
Other images spotlighted group dinners, sightseeing and partying in fluorescent-lit clubs.
Balionis took some well-deserved time off after 19 weeks on the road with “Golf on CBS.”
Last week, she shared a tribute to her broadcast team, including photos from the season.
“Hard to put into words what 19 weeks on the road really looks like,” Balionis wrote. “For us announcers, we have it easy — we show up to work with hotel rooms already booked, everything we need waiting at check-in. Our headsets and mics work flawlessly, our sets are stocked, and our camera operators have been setting the scene for days.”
Balionis made headlines off the course last May when a Daily Mail report linked her and McIlroy after he filed for divorce from his wife of seven years, Erica Stoll.
McIlroy, 36, and Stoll have since reunited, and his divorce petition was voluntarily dismissed.
Fans noticed Balionis wasn’t wearing her wedding ring last February while covering the Genesis Invitational.
Balionis married former North Carolina quarterback Bryn Renner, who also had a brief career in the NFL, in 2022.
Balionis, who wasn’t wearing her ring in the Ibiza photos, has not publicly addressed speculation about a divorce, but Renner no longer appears on her social media pages.
Us Weekly confirmed last spring that Balinois and the reigning Masters champ “are not dating and only have a professional relationship.”
Balionis joined CBS Sports in 2017 as a golf reporter and also serves as a sideline reporter for select NFL ON CBS games and CBS Sports Network college football games.

argos_summary: Saints center Will Clapp has been placed on injured reserve due to a Lisfranc injury sustained during the preseason opener, ending his season before it began. Clapp, a New Orleans native and LSU alum, had re-signed with the Saints earlier this year after spending time with the Chargers and Bills. With starting center Erik McCoy also dealing with injuries, Torricelli Simpkins is expected to step in for Clapp.
